content.raw:
Replace this with: `beforeKickOffState(std::make_shared<BeforeKickOffState>(BeforeKickOff, this)),`

`std::make_shared` is the recommended way of allocating an object using a std::shared_ptr. It's a little bit more efficient than `new` and safer. Apply the same suggestion to the rest of `new ...`
content.html:
Replace this with: beforeKickOffState(std::make_shared<BeforeKickOffState>(BeforeKickOff, this)),

std::make_shared is the recommended way of allocating an object using a std::shared_ptr. It's a little bit more efficient than new and safer. Apply the same suggestion to the rest of new ...

content.raw: There's no need to add the space between `> >` in C++11 anymore.
content.html: There's no need to add the space between > > in C++11 anymore.

pull_request.title: Adding GameState class and tests to default branch

update.description:
This pull request will introduce the GameState class and its associated unit tests to the default branch. The GameState class contains logic for determining when to transition the play mode of the soccer simulation as well as handling various rule violations. 

More information on most but not all of the rules can be found here:
http://chaosscripting.net/files/competitions/RoboCup/WorldCup/2014/3DSim/RCSoccerSim3D_Rules2013.pdf
update.title: Adding GameState class and tests to default branch

content.raw: Pose3 is a wrapper for a vector3 and a quarternion. I dont see how that would be different from what I am doing now. Changing it to a Pose3 would also mean a lot of code refactoring as well.
content.html: Pose3 is a wrapper for a vector3 and a quarternion. I dont see how that would be different from what I am doing now. Changing it to a Pose3 would also mean a lot of code refactoring as well.
